qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital and Tremont General Hospital, what are the ages of patients O. Myers and L. Bailey?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital, patient O. Myers is 13 years old; according to the hospitalization records of Tremont General Hospital, patient L. Bailey is 27 years old.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital and Tremont General Hospital, what are the chief complaints of patients O. Myers and L. Bailey?

content: Palpitations and excessive sweating for 2 weeks
Experiencing auditory hallucinations and delusional thoughts for the past 1 month.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital, patient O. Myers' chief complaint is palpitations and excessive sweating for 2 weeks; according to the hospitalization records of Tremont General Hospital, patient L. Bailey's chief complaint is experiencing auditory hallucinations and delusional thoughts for the past 1 month.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital and Tremont General Hospital, what are the diagnoses of patients O. Myers and L. Bailey?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital, patient O. Myers was diagnosed with hyperthyroidism; according to the hospitalization records of Tremont General Hospital, patient L. Bailey was diagnosed with schizophrenia.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital and Tremont General Hospital, what are the family histories of patients O. Myers and L. Bailey?

content: Family History: Mother with history of hypothyroidism, father healthy, one healthy younger sibling.
Family History: Family reports no history of schizophrenia or other major mental health disorders.
Parents are healthy; has one younger sibling who is also healthy.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital, patient O. Myers' family history includes a mother with hypothyroidism and a healthy father and sibling; according to the hospitalization records of Tremont General Hospital, patient L. Bailey's family history reports no history of schizophrenia or other major mental health disorders, with healthy parents and one healthy sibling.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital and Tremont General Hospital, who was admitted earlier, O. Myers or L. Bailey?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: O. Myers was admitted on 20th April, and L. Bailey was admitted on 24th September. O. Myers was admitted earlier.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital and Tremont General Hospital, whose pulse rate is higher, O. Myers or L. Bailey?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: O. Myers's pulse rate is 110 bpm, and L. Bailey's pulse rate is 72 bpm. O. Myers's pulse rate is higher.
